sub_topic: Finding the cross product of two vectors using trigonometry
message_1: Suppose vector A has components (3, -1, 7) and vector B has components (-2, 4, 1). Find the cross product of vectors A and B using trigonometry.
message_2:
To find the cross product of two vectors A and B, we can use the formula:

A x B = (AyBz - AzBy, AzBx - AxBz, AxBy - AyBx)

where A = (Ax, Ay, Az) and B = (Bx, By, Bz).

Given A = (3, -1, 7) and B = (-2, 4, 1), we can find the cross product as follows:

A x B = ((-1)(1) - (7)(4), (7)(-2) - (3)(1), (3)(4) - (-1)(-2))
A x B = (-1 - 28, -14 - 3, 12 - 2)
A x B = (-29, -17, 10)

So, the cross product of vectors A and B is (-29, -17, 10). Note that we didn't use trigonometry to solve this problem, as the cross product can be found directly using the given components of the vectors.
